p: In 1601, the House of Kuroda established a new castle and town near to Hakata. This new town was named Fukuoka after the feudal lord Nagamasa Kuroda's birthplace in Okayama Prefecture. In April 1889, the government issued an order for municipalisation, and the towns of Fukuoka and Hakata were merged. ‘Fukuoka’ was chosen as the name for the new city. At this time, their populations were 20,410 and 25,677 respectively ( Fukuoka City, 2009a).
